decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to establish early board presence and apply constant pressure on the opponent. It accomplishes this by utilizing aggressive Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Matter Reshaper, supported by mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It has a well-rounded mana base with Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to ensure smooth casting of creatures, and also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember for removal and additional damage.

The main concept of the Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to utilize efficient removal spells such as Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to control the board, while generating value with cards like Dark Confidant and Tarmogoyf. Lingering Souls provides a steady stream of flying threats, and the planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope offer additional disruption and card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp into powerful threats using the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) and color fixing artifacts (Chromatic Star, Chromatic Sphere). The deck aims to control the game through removal spells (Dismember, Oblivion Stone), search spells (Expedition Map, Sylvan Scrying, Ancient Stirrings), and versatile threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Karn Liberated. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while maintaining control over the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a powerful mana base known as UrzaTron, which allows for large threats to be played early in the game. The aim is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Mine) quickly using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, then drop game-changing threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated. With access to powerful removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like Oblivion Stone, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer while disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to control the board. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate advantage. Lingering Souls provides additional threats and can help to grind out value against control decks. The mana base supports the deck's color requirements and allows for consistent casting of spells.

This deck aims to control the game by using efficient removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful threats such as Celestial Colonnade and Torrential Gearhulk to close out the game once it has gained control. The deck can handle a variety of threats through its versatile removal suite and can outgrind opponents in longer games thanks to its card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage. Overall, it seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a winning position.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes various control elements, such as removal spells and board wipes, to deal with opponents' threats while searching for powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with its versatile threats and overwhelming mana advantage. The combination of ramp, removal, and powerful threats make it a formidable control deck in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows you to cast powerful colorless spells such as Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust and Oblivion Stone to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game until it can win with its powerful threats.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with small artifact creatures and pump them up with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. With efficient mana sources like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, along with powerful threats like Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game quickly. With a mix of aggression and resilience, this deck can be a formidable force in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive red creatures and a mix of burn spells to deal direct damage. By consistently casting small but efficient spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Searing Blaze, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The deck also utilizes cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix to protect its creatures and gain some life back if needed. Overall, the goal is to win the game as quickly as possible through a combination of creature beatdown and burn spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Leonin Arbiter, Ghost Quarter, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while creatures like Blade Splicer and Restoration Angel provide a fast clock. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play and allows for instant speed interactions. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while advancing its own game plan to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive swarm of Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while building up the power of creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure on the opponent, making it difficult for them to effectively respond.

The main concept of this UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Dismember to control the board and ensure the opponent's threats are dealt with efficiently. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing life as a resource to enable powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes ways to pump up its creatures quickly and protect them with Stubborn Denial, allowing for a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle. The inclusion of Traverse the Ulvenwald provides additional flexibility and consistency in finding key pieces, making it a versatile and dynamic deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively and using the Death's Shadow creatures to quickly reduce your own life total in order to pump up their power. It also includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control your opponent's hand and removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. The deck aims to lower your life total to power up Death's Shadow while using cards like Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil to further control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board state and hand, while also disrupting their mana base. It utilizes counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent and protect its win conditions. The deck's win conditions come in the form of resilient threat like Celestial Colonnade and Gideon of the Trials, with some card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Sphinx's Revelation to maintain card advantage. By maintaining control of the game and denying the opponent's resources, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent to secure a victory.
